Don't Let the Candle Off
A man had a little daughter---an only and much-loved child. He lived for her--- she was his whole _ . He was so happy to hear his girl's voice that he hardly imagined what he would do _ her. But unluckily , one day, his daughter became seriously ill. He was very _ . He tried all he could to _ her. At last, his efforts   was  _  and the child died. The father became a bitter recluse   after that, shutting  _  away from his friends and refusing  every activity that might _ him back to his normal self. But one night he had a dream. He was in heaven, seeing a group of little child angels. They were dressed in white and _ in a line passing by the Great White Throne. Every angel _ a candle. He noticed that all the candles were bright except one. Then he found that the child with the _ candle was his own little daughter.  _  to her, he held her in his _ ,hugged her gently, and then asked, "Why is it, darling, that your candle alone is unlighted?" His daughter said, "Daddy, they often relight it, but your  _ always put it out." Just then he woke up The lesson was very clear, and its effects were immediate. From that hour on he was not a recluse, but socialized  freely and gladly with his former friends and colleagues. No longer would his darling's candle be put out by his useless tears.
